snippet: Players at U.S. Soccer-affiliated academies are no longer permitted to play for their high school teams, forcing them into profound choices that can be complicated — and costly — for their families.
abstract: United States Soccer Federation's decision that players in its affiliated academies could no longer play for their high school teams, has forced profound choices on students that can be complicated and costly for their families; officials conclude that having young players split their time between schools and clubs will never produce enough world-class talent needed to compete at top international level with countries that have huge training and cultural advantages.
lead_paragraph: Players at U.S. Soccer-affiliated academies are no longer permitted to play for their high school teams, forcing them into profound choices that can be complicated — and costly — for their families.

headline.seo: Club Soccer Pulls at Players’ Ties to the Hometown Team
headline.main: Forced to Choose in Soccer: Club or Community
